title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing othersâ€™ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement andrewallenbruce@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozillaâ€™s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Version dev
text: added asc pin, redid aff pin

title: Version dev
text: Provider superclass now child class Unknown Medicare range/name lookups Added MedicareProvider class

title: Version dev
text: standardized facility type slots removed roxyglobals dependency

title: Version dev
text: props renamed: ccn -> number, sequence_number -> sequence namespace convert methods

title: Version dev
text: added esrd, irf & ltch testing data

title: Version dev
text: added extended slot Multi-Campus Hospital ccn type

title: Version dev
text: length check added, extension can NULL now

title: Version dev
text: Type, State, Sequence classes added dedicated State class

title: Version dev
text: initial as_data_frame method (#2) added MedicaidOnlySequence, MedicaidOnlyType, IPPSExcludedType

title: Version dev
text: IPPSExcludedUnit now working standard is_* prefix added logical predicates OPOSequence -> OpoSequence & OPOType -> OpoType, standard CamelCase convention class names initial base parse() sketch

title: Version dev
text: added EmergencySequence class converted Emergency, Supplier OPO ranges integers (#1)

title: Version dev
text: as_data_frame methods implemented (#2) ranges converted integer vectors (#1)

title: Version dev
text: ccn_ sketch S7 initial parser added air formatter

title: Version dev
text: slice_ fns now identify entity type

title: Version dev
text: State class now constructor, accepts length 1 input Fixed mistake MOF range label

title: Version dev
text: added slot @eipps updated internal data structures

title: Version dev
text: added CMS Regional Office internal data

title: Version dev
text: added region office slots State class

title: Version dev
text: fix: decode() handles parsed unparsed input now

title: Version dev
text: fix: eipps_types internal dataset chore: documentation

title: Version dev
text: fix: bug provider_type fix: states internal dataset

title: Version dev
text: unit_parents internal dataset check_state assertion class preserved .data.frame method

title: Version dev
text: initial Unit @parent implementation .data.frame method decoded ccns (closes #2)

what: ccn: CMS Certification Numbers â€” ccn-package
title: ccn: CMS Certification Numbers â€” ccn-package
text: S7 class representing CMS Certification Number, uniform way identifying Providers Suppliers participated Medicare Medicaid programs. CCN alphanumeric string, either 6 10 characters length, encodes Provider/Supplier's State Facility type, defined CMS Manual System Pub. 100-07 Medicare State Operations: Provider Certification.

title: ccn: CMS Certification Numbers â€” ccn-package
text: Maintainer: Andrew Allen Bruce andrewallenbruce@gmail.com [copyright holder]

title: Emergency Hospitals â€” emergency
text: CCNs assigned Emergency Hospitals (Federal non-Federal) participate Medicare program.

title: Emergency Hospitals â€” emergency
text: Emergency hospitals identified 6-position alphanumeric CCN. Positions one two identify state hospital located. Position six, alpha character, identifies whether hospital Federal (F) non-Federal (E). Positions three, four five represent sequence beginning 001. sequence identifies order, state, CCN issued. example, CCN 34th emergency hospital Maryland 21034E. Regional Office assigns CCN strict numerical sequence without regard Federal non-Federal status.

title: Emergency Hospitals â€” emergency
code: emergency("21034E") #> <ccn::Emergency> #>  @ ccn  : chr "21034E" #>  @ state: <ccn::State> #>  .. @ abbr  : chr "MD" #>  .. @ name  : chr "Maryland" #>  .. @ region: chr "III" #>  .. @ office: chr "Philadelphia" #>  @ range: chr "001-999" #>  @ type : <ccn::Type> #>  .. @ abbr: chr "NF" #>  .. @ desc: chr "Non-Federal" emergency("12345F") #> <ccn::Emergency> #>  @ ccn  : chr "12345F" #>  @ state: <ccn::State> #>  .. @ abbr  : chr "HI" #>  .. @ name  : chr "Hawaii" #>  .. @ region: chr "IX" #>  .. @ office: chr "San Francisco" #>  @ range: chr "001-999" #>  @ type : <ccn::Type> #>  .. @ abbr: chr "F" #>  .. @ desc: chr "Federal" emergency("11038F") # USAF Hospital (Moody) #> <ccn::Emergency> #>  @ ccn  : chr "11038F" #>  @ state: <ccn::State> #>  .. @ abbr  : chr "GA" #>  .. @ name  : chr "Georgia" #>  .. @ region: chr "IV" #>  .. @ office: chr "Atlanta" #>  @ range: chr "001-999" #>  @ type : <ccn::Type> #>  .. @ abbr: chr "F" #>  .. @ desc: chr "Federal"

title: Medicaid-Only Providers â€” medicaid
text: Title XIX-providers identified 6-position alphanumeric CCN. Positions one two identify state provider located. Position three, alpha character, identifies type facility, either level type care provided. Positions four, five six represent sequence beginning 001.

title: Organ Procurement Organizations â€” organ
text: Organ procurement organizations (OPOs) assigned 6-digit alphanumeric CCN. first 2 digits identify State code. third digit alpha character P. remaining 3 digits unique facility identifier.

title: State Code Conversions â€” state_code
text: Convert CCN state codes abbreviations full names. Convert state abbreviations RO region office (city).

title: State Code Conversions â€” state_code
text: code character vector 2-character CCN state codes. abbr character vector 2-character state abbreviations. ccn 6-character CCN code.

title: State Code Conversions â€” state_code
code: state_region(abbr = "CA") #> [1] "IX" state_office(abbr = "NY") #> [1] "New York City" state_abbr(code = c("00", "A5", "01", "99")) #> [1] "AZ" "MS" "AL" "FC" state_name(code = c("00", "A5", "01", "99")) #> [1] "Arizona"         "Mississippi"     "Alabama"         "Foreign Country" state(ccn = "A5XXX") #> <ccn::State> #>  @ abbr  : chr "MS" #>  @ name  : chr "Mississippi" #>  @ region: chr "IV" #>  @ office: chr "Atlanta" state(ccn = "869999") #> <ccn::State> #>  @ abbr  : chr "NC" #>  @ name  : chr "North Carolina" #>  @ region: chr "IV" #>  @ office: chr "Atlanta"

title: Suppliers â€” supplier
text: CCNs assigned Medicare suppliers paid Part B carriers

title: Suppliers â€” supplier
text: Suppliers 10-digit alphanumeric CCN. first 2 digits identify State supplier located. third digit alpha character identifies type facility. remaining 7 digits unique facility identifier. RO (Regional Office) assigns following alpha-characters third position indicated: C: Ambulatory Surgical Centers (ASC) D: Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments 1988 Laboratories (CLIA) X: Portable X-Ray Facilities (PXRF)

title: Suppliers â€” supplier
code: supplier("10C0001062") #> <ccn::Supplier> #>  @ ccn      : chr "10C0001062" #>  @ state    : <ccn::State> #>  .. @ abbr  : chr "FL" #>  .. @ name  : chr "Florida" #>  .. @ region: chr "IV" #>  .. @ office: chr "Atlanta" #>  @ range    : chr "0000001-9999999" #>  @ type     : <ccn::Type> #>  .. @ abbr: chr "ASC" #>  .. @ desc: chr "Ambulatory Surgical Center" #>  @ extension: chr NA supplier("45D0634589") #> <ccn::Supplier> #>  @ ccn      : chr "45D0634589" #>  @ state    : <ccn::State> #>  .. @ abbr  : chr "TX" #>  .. @ name  : chr "Texas" #>  .. @ region: chr "VI" #>  .. @ office: chr "Dallas" #>  @ range    : chr "0000001-9999999" #>  @ type     : <ccn::Type> #>  .. @ abbr: chr "CLIA" #>  .. @ desc: chr "Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments of 1988 (CLIA) Laboratory" #>  @ extension: chr NA supplier("21X0009807") #> <ccn::Supplier> #>  @ ccn      : chr "21X0009807" #>  @ state    : <ccn::State> #>  .. @ abbr  : chr "MD" #>  .. @ name  : chr "Maryland" #>  .. @ region: chr "III" #>  .. @ office: chr "Philadelphia" #>  @ range    : chr "0000001-9999999" #>  @ type     : <ccn::Type> #>  .. @ abbr: chr "PXRF" #>  .. @ desc: chr "Portable X-Ray Facility" #>  @ extension: chr NA supplier("12C0001062") #> <ccn::Supplier> #>  @ ccn      : chr "12C0001062" #>  @ state    : <ccn::State> #>  .. @ abbr  : chr "HI" #>  .. @ name  : chr "Hawaii" #>  .. @ region: chr "IX" #>  .. @ office: chr "San Francisco" #>  @ range    : chr "0000001-9999999" #>  @ type     : <ccn::Type> #>  .. @ abbr: chr "ASC" #>  .. @ desc: chr "Ambulatory Surgical Center" #>  @ extension: chr NA

title: Hospital Units â€” unit
text: alpha character third position CCN identifies either hospitals swing-bed approval, rehabilitation units, psychiatric units excluded IPPS payment. first 2 digits identify State provider located. third position (alpha) identifies type unit swing-bed designation. last 3 digits must match last 3 digits parent provider.
